subject: Personal Finance
title: Menu Costs
description: Learn Menu Costs in one minute.

hook.text: Every time a restaurant reprints menus because prices changed, that's a real cost of inflation.

buildup.text: Economists call these 'menu costs' â€” the expense of constantly updating prices across a business.

discovery.text: It's not just menus. Catalogs, websites, vending machines, and contracts all need price updates.

twist.text: During hyperinflation, some businesses changed prices multiple times per day. The cost was enormous.

climax.text: Digital pricing has reduced menu costs. But the cognitive cost of tracking ever-changing prices remains.

quiz.question: What are 'menu costs' in economics?
options: The expense of updating prices across a business
The cost of food at restaurants
